0.title: ISA
0.content: A prtvm implementation can support various subsets of instructions . | Base (the bare minimum, CLI capabilities) | Math (advanced mathematics capabilties) | Graphical (rendering with OpenGL) | File (file I/O operations) | Network (network I/O operations) | OS (accessing the OS directly) | . Similar to Risc-V, these letters showcase what features are supported. A feature-complete prtvm implementation would be labelled as BMGFNO. B can be omitted, as it is the bare baseline to be considered useful.

1.title: Types
1.content: The following is a list of how all types that exist in the prtvm. | Label | Full name | Function | . | bool | Boolean | Used for binary true or false variables | . | i32 | Integer | Used for signed 32-Bit numbers | .
